title: How to Upload Photos to Flickr with Your iPad

steps.headline: Go to Flickr.
steps.description: Look at the homepage and click the "Upload" button, which will allow you to upload your photos.

steps.headline: Click on Choose File.
steps.description: Doing this will allow you to take a photo, or choose an existing one.

steps.headline: Choose the image that you would like to upload.
steps.description:
This could be a photo of yourself, one of your hobbies, something in your house, etc. Click on an image to choose it. Repeat this step if you want to upload more images. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/0\/0e\/Upload-Photos-to-Flickr-with-Your-iPad-Step-3Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Upload-Photos-to-Flickr-with-Your-iPad-Step-3Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/0\/0e\/Upload-Photos-to-Flickr-with-Your-iPad-Step-3Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Add tags to your image.
steps.description: These are meant to describe it in a concise way, and others will be able to view these tags when they see your photo.

steps.headline: Choose the privacy settings.
steps.description: The photo can either be Public (Visible to Everyone) or Private (only you, and maybe friends and/or family can see them). The Private option can be chosen for your safety.

steps.headline: Show advanced settings.
steps.description: Advanced settings let you customize the safety level, content type (photos or videos) and the option to hide these images for public searches.

steps.headline: Click on Upload.
steps.description: Allow your images to process for some time, title and describe each one and they will appear in your Photostream. You can also add them to a set if you want.

text:
Go to Flickr. Look at the homepage and click the "Upload" button, which will allow you to upload your photos. Click on Choose File. Doing this will allow you to take a photo, or choose an existing one. Choose the image that you would like to upload. This could be a photo of yourself, one of your hobbies, something in your house, etc. Click on an image to choose it. Repeat this step if you want to upload more images. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/0\/0e\/Upload-Photos-to-Flickr-with-Your-iPad-Step-3Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Upload-Photos-to-Flickr-with-Your-iPad-Step-3Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/0\/0e\/Upload-Photos-to-Flickr-with-Your-iPad-Step-3Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Add tags to your image. These are meant to describe it in a concise way, and others will be able to view these tags when they see your photo. Choose the privacy settings. The photo can either be Public (Visible to Everyone) or Private (only you, and maybe friends and/or family can see them). The Private option can be chosen for your safety. Show advanced settings. Advanced settings let you customize the safety level, content type (photos or videos) and the option to hide these images for public searches. Click on Upload. Allow your images to process for some time, title and describe each one and they will appear in your Photostream. You can also add them to a set if you want.
